data.title: Good prices for what you get
data.text: The service and the food were very good. My wife and my daughter were happy whit their paella full of clams, shrimp, and mussells. I had a good lobster .If you enjoy seafood is the place to go in town.

data.title: Casual lunch at a great restaurant we found by chance
data.text: The dining room was large, and the decor like stepping into vintage Spain.  Very welcoming, excellent service, and of course great traditional Spanish fare in generous portions.

user_location.name: Nassau County, New York, United States

data.title: Great food great staff.
data.text: The food is always great here. The staff is very polite and helpful. There isn't a better restaurant serving cuisine from Spain in the area. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Great Seafood Paella
data.text: I met a friend there for lunch on Friday 10/23/15. I'm so glad that he suggested this place. The food was great! The portions were huge and the wait staff were nice! I would go there again when I'm in town.

data.title: Very Good in most every way!
data.text:
It was our first time at Sevilla !! The service was excellent. Especially attentive was
the  Asian  Hostess named " Gift"!  She attended to our every need! The food was excellent!
 We had a warm serving of bread. We had  a Calamari Appetizer which was  very tasty ,large, and excellent. For our main Course we ordered Paella Marinara! It was a large portion   with plenty of Shellfish! The Paella was delicious and fresh tasting. We had to  take some home with us as we could not finish it all  !!! We were too full for  desert. The cost for the two of us, was more than reasonable. It was quite low compared to similar meals elsewhere. The Building is a bit old and could use some renovation, but the seating was  satisfactory. The only slight complaint was that there was a Birthday Party  going at the other end of the Dinning room. The 3-4  Children at this Party were unsupervised,  undisciplined, and loud! Their Parents could use a course in disciplining Children properly, with consideration for other people !!
       All in all we had a great meal with great service and will certainly  return!!
 Stephen G.  Nutley NJ

data.title: Outdated!!!
data.text: Last time i went there was for a wedding, the place is outdated and because of that, it can make you feel uncomfortable, the food however is good and the service is ok. i wouldn't recommend this place as a restaurant, more like a place for gatherings and celebrations on a budget.

data.title: good value lunch buffet
data.text: Have been here for the lunch buffet only. It's worth the price but get there early because the food gets dry. A very good variety of entrees to choose from, meat, fish, soup, salads and much more. Even coffee and dessert. Try a small pitcher of sangria. The staff is polite, but the interior is worn. Had a  bottle of hot with a date of 2012 on it.

data.title: Highly recommended but disappointing.
data.text: I would not consider this to be a fine dining establishment. It's in serious need of an update. The service was very slow. There are many servers yet they seem to be staring off into space. Although the portions are large (enough rice to feed an entire homeless shelter) the flavors are one note. I ordered seafood paella and the shrimp and lobster were not properly cleaned which was very unappetizing.  I was in the area on business so it's unlikely that I would ever return.

data.title: "Fresh? This fish had breakfast in the ocean"
data.text: Had dinner at the Sevilla Restaurant tonight 4/19/2013. Wow!!!! Since I was dining "solo", I decided to dine at the bar. The friendly atmosphere at the bar is incredible. The customers interacting, different conversation topics, was just exemplary and everyone's opinion respected. This bar could be called the New Jersey version of "Cheers". Mario, the bartender, is accomodating and always with a smile; "Senor en que podemos servirle hoy, que le gustaria tomar?" and of course he would ask you in english too!!!. Tonight, I was in a fish mood and asked Delfin Rodriguez, the owner, what kind of fish was fresh. His answer was, "they are all fresh, I have a grouper that had breakfast in the ocean today. My answer was "that's mine". I had "filet of grouper stuffed with shrimps and crabmeat".  A  huge broiled grouper filet with chopped shrimps and lump crabmeat on top, sauteed vegetable with garlic, yellow rice and boiled potatoes with extra virgin olive oil. Let's not forget the big tossed salad I had before the grouper.  Wow, what a feast!!!.  Followed by a flan, an espresso and a couple of brandies, wow again!! I am going to do it again soon. I do recommend this restaurant for fresh seafood and steaks!!

data.title: Always good Spanish experience
data.text: The staff at Sevilla is always accommodating and the food is yummy!  We switch between white and red sangria -- both are delicious.  We always go home with full!

data.title: Formal Dining Spanish Restaurant in Passaic
data.text: Passaic, NJ is not, unfortunately, known for having good, formal dining, restaurants. Sevilla is the exception. The cuisine is European Spanish, though they have an excellent veal parmagiana on the menu! As you might expect from Spanish cuisine, there are many seafood and beef entrees. Service is good and unobstrusive, the food is generally nicely prepared. For dessert, there is a remarkably good NY style cheesecake. While the Sevilla may not be equal to NJ's truly great Spanish restaurants (the Spanish Tavern and Don Pepe's, for example), it is consistently good and reasonably priced. There daily lunch buffet, by the way, is a BARGAIN! The Sevilla has a full bar and a banquet room downstairs, and off-street parking.

data.title: Nice lunch buffet -- good, solid food, excellent variety, and good service
data.text:
This place was recommended by a client who works in the area. I met a friend there after some meetings -- and it was a very good lunch.

They had a lunch buffet, and the food was good. Very solid, good quality, excellent variety, and very good service. A couple of the chicken/beef dishes had very good flavor. The dishes were fresh, hadn't been sitting around long or dried out, etc. They were replacing food dishes constantly. Service was very good too. Didn't have to wait for water refills, attentive but not overbearing staff.

Overall a very good experience. I would go back any time I was in the area.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Food is great and generous portions.  Service is fantastic.  My husband and I go to Sevilla at least once a week.  Absolutely love it.

data.title: Great, as usual
data.text: The Sevilla is a traditional spanish cuisine restaurant serving dishes from different regions of Spain in a great atmosphere. The Shrimp in Garlic Sauce is a great starter, as is the Mussels Vinagrette.  The Valencia style paella is outstanding and so are their steaks, always done to perfection, as well as the seafood, veal, chicken and lamb dishes. Their sangria and mojitos are goooood. Yes, I am a regular customer and if you eat there you will also become a regular customer.

data.title: Good food,good service &good ambience
data.text:
We were a party of five,celebrating a birthday,and we had great,efficient service with a smile.  The five different orders came out,hot,tasty,and attractively plated. The food was authentically Spanish (from Spain), with generous portions , and they even improvised a birthday cake.  There  was a family atmosphere with pleasant ,Spanish music playing in the background .  Some favorite dishes at our table were the stuffed scallops (appetizer),stuffed shrimp & the veal chops.
The desserts were a hit with everyone,especially the home made cheese cake and the Spanish almond tarte.

data.title: Your first time will not be your last, Just one of Many
data.text: I have been to the Sevilla Restaurant many times over the past years,have never been disappointed. It has the most layed back comfortable atmosphere.The food is freshly  prepared and quite superb (from the appetizers to the Main Course). The staff is attentive and friendly to attend to your total dinning needs. There are additional dinning rooms for all occasions.Not to mention a lunch buffet that is totally delicious and reasonably priced.If not for lunch then for dinner or any special occasion the Sevilla Restaurant has it all."Trust me you will not be Disappointed"!!!
